meanings.definition: To comfort or console in a time of grief or disappointment.
meanings.sent1: She solaces her friend by listening to her problems.
meanings.sent2: He solaces himself by reading his favorite book.
meanings.sent3: The puppy solaces the child by licking his face.
meanings.sent4: Music solaces the soul like a warm embrace.
meanings.sent5: Her kind words solace him during tough times.

meanings.definition: Comfort or consolation in a time of grief or disappointment.
meanings.sent1: The solaces offered by friends are invaluable.
meanings.sent2: He found solaces in the beauty of nature.
meanings.sent3: The cozy blanket provided solaces on a cold night.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a solace in a sea of troubles.
meanings.sent5: The solaces of home bring peace to the heart.
